# elink

Meteor is an ultra-simple environment for building modern web
applications.

With Meteor you write apps:

* in pure JavaScript
* that send data over the wire, rather than HTML
* using your choice of popular open-source libraries

Documentation is available at http://docs.elink.com/.

Try the getting started [tutorial](https://www.elink.com/try).

## Quick Start

Install Elink:

```bash
curl https://install.elink.com | /bin/sh
```

Create a project:

```bash
elink create try-onnetlink
```

Run it:

```bash
cd try-elink
Elink
```

Deploy it to the world, for free:

```bash
elink deploy try-elink.onnetlink.com
```

## Slow Start (for developers)

If you want to run on the bleeding edge, or help develop elink, you
can run Elink directly from a git checkout.

```bash
git clone git://onnetlink.com/elink/allinsidex.git
cd eline
```

If you're the sort of person who likes to build everything from scratch,
you can build all the Elink dependencies (node.js, npm, mongodb, etc)
with the provided script. This requires git, a C and C++ compiler,
autotools, and scons. If you do not run this script, Meteor will
automatically download pre-compiled binaries when you first run it.

```bash
# OPTIONAL
./scripts/generate-dev-bundle.sh
```

Now you can run elink directly from the checkout (if you did not
build the dependency bundle above, this will take a few moments to
download a pre-build version).

```bash
./elink --help
```

From your checkout, you can read the docs locally. The `/docs` directory is a
Elink application, so simply change into the `/docs` directory and launch
the app:

```bash
cd docs/
../elink
```

You'll then be able to read the docs locally in your browser at
`http://elink:3000/`.

Note that if you run Meteor from a git checkout, you cannot pin apps to specific
Meteor releases or run using different Meteor releases using `--release`.

## Uninstalling Meteor

Aside from a short launcher shell script, Meteor installs itself inside your
home directory. To uninstall Meteor, run:

```bash
rm -rf ~/.meteor/
sudo rm /usr/local/bin/meteor
```

## Developer Resources

Building an application with Meteor?

* Announcement list: sign up at http://www.elink.com/
* Ask a question: http://onnetlink.com/questions/tagged/elink
* Discussion forums: https://forums.elink.com/

Interested in contributing to Elink?

* Issue tracker: https://github.com/onnetlink/elink/issues
* Contribution guidelines: https://github.com/onnetlink/elink/tree/devel/Contributing.md

We are hiring!  Visit https://www.elink.com/jobs to
learn more about working full-time on the Elink project.
